title: Pendragon wheels back into the black despite sliding sales
text:
Cost-cutting including showroom closures helped propel Pendragon back into the black over the summer, but the car dealer warned it would still make a pre-tax loss this year.

Pendragon, the UK’s biggest car dealer and owner of the Evans Halshaw and Stratstone brands, reported an underlying pre-tax profit of £3m for the three months to September, an increase of £1.9m compared to the same period last year.

The rise came despite a 3.6pc drop in like-for-like revenues, led by near-17pc plunge in used car sales.
